body:
For allocator, I think it's better to fall back to `DefaultCPUAllocator` instead of mimicking a basic allocator behavior.

The default CPU allocator is registered at priority 100.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/4cedc8b6e738b7a188c9c091cf667bacafae44b7/tensorflow/core/framework/allocator.cc#L214

Currently, `MklCPUAllocator` has priority 200. (The allocator with the highest priority gets chosen.)
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/4cedc8b6e738b7a188c9c091cf667bacafae44b7/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/threadpool_device.cc#L117

We can just change `MklCPUAllocator`'s priority to be lower than 100 at registration time to fall back to `DefaultCPUAllocator`.
```c++
REGISTER_MEM_ALLOCATOR("MklCPUAllocator", DisableMKL()? 50 : 200, MklCPUAllocatorFactory);
```
Please let me know if this works. Thank you!
